text: hey guys this is Alex thanks for
clicking and welcome to this beginner
lesson on simple present yes/no
questions now these are not yes/no
questions with the be verb in the
present tense if you'd like to learn
about yes/no questions with the be verb
you can check out another lesson on
engvid comm okay for this lesson we are
looking at simple present yes/no
questions which use the do verb okay so
on the board we have two sentences he
works downtown I live in New Delhi
now the first sentence he works downtown
imagine that the answer is yes he works
downtown so if the answer is yes he
works downtown what is the question okay
here the verb is works
hey the verb is not the be verb if you
have a simple present sentence where
there is no be verb when you make a
question you need the auxiliary verb
which is the due verb okay so here if
you have studied the do verb you will
know with he the subject he we say he
does right not he do okay not he did
well he did in the past and the present
its he does okay so here no be verb to
make a yes/no question what we have to
do is put the auxiliary verb do now
since the subject is he it does he you
follow it with the subject does he work
down town okay now one thing you have to
notice here is in the third person with
present simple verbs we know that you
have to add the S okay we say he works
in the affirmative he works downtown
with the S okay you say I work no s you
work no s he she it
works with s so you see this and you say
hmm he does he work why is it work
why is there no s well when you make a
yes/no question or when you use an
auxiliary verb right like do is an
auxiliary verb the next verb will be the
base form
hey the base base base form okay so here
we have does he work downtown how do we
give a short answer to this well he say
yes he does for the affirmative or if
the answer is he doesn't work say no he
doesn't and now one mistake you have to
be careful with is to not say yes he
works okay or no he he doesn't work okay
when you give a short answer you need to
only give the auxilary yes he does okay
you can also say yes he does work
downtown but you can't say yes he does
work the meaning is different you can't
say that in the second sentence we have
I live in New Delhi
okay the subject is I the verb is lived
there is no be verb so if there is no be
verb in a simple present sentence if you
make AI yes/no question you need the
auxiliary do okay so the question is do
we say do because the subject is really
you you're asking the still another
person do you and again always we have
do or does plus the subject plus the
base verb do you live
and New Delhi okay now here do you live
in New Delhi again Zoo or does the do
verb + subject + the base verb always
the base verb okay now the yes/no
answers yes I do
no I don't okay guys so it's very very
important to remember this formula for
yes/no simple present questions you have
do verb okay let's write this on the
board I'm going to write it here do or
does depends on the subject plus the
subject plus the base verb okay so
please remember this formula when making
yes/no questions that don't have the be
verb okay guys if you want to test your
